priority.when: Use at the start to get all review comments and PR metadata.
priority.why: Provides the core context of what needs to be fixed from a human perspective.

priority.when: After getting comments, to check the technical status.
priority.why: Quickly identifies if there are failing automated checks that need investigation.

priority.when: When changes affect user-facing content, i18n files, or UI components that require translation.
priority.why: Ensures translation consistency across all supported languages when PR fixes involve user-facing changes.

priority.when: After pushing a fix, to confirm that the changes have resolved the CI/CD failures.
priority.why: Provides real-time feedback on whether the fix was successful.

best_practices.practice: Always fetch details to get the branch name, owner, repo slug, and mergeable state.
Parse all comments to create a checklist of required changes.
Ignore comments that are not actionable or have been resolved.
Use this command to get the exact error messages from failing tests.
Search the log for keywords like 'error', 'failed', or 'exception' to quickly find the root cause.
Always specify run ID explicitly to avoid interactive selection prompts.
Always use --force flag to avoid interactive branch selection.
Format: 'gh pr checkout --force'
If gh checkout fails, fallback to git fetch + checkout pattern.
Use explicit git configuration for automated commits.
Format: 'git -c user.name="PR Fixer" -c user.email="pr-fixer@local" commit'
Use --force-with-lease for safer force pushing.
Check git status programmatically with --porcelain flag.
Use git rebase --dry-run to detect conflicts before attempting rebase.

conflict_resolution.step: Use 'git rebase --dry-run main' to detect conflicts
If conflicts detected, resolve manually via file editing
Use 'git status --porcelain' to identify conflicted files
Edit files to resolve conflicts, removing conflict markers
Use 'git add .' and commit with explicit author info

best_practices.practice: Use --json flag to get structured output instead of interactive watch.
Format: 'gh pr checks --json state,conclusion,name'
Poll periodically instead of using --watch for automated workflows.
Use 'gh run list --pr ' to get detailed workflow status.
After analyzing all the problems (reviews, tests, conflicts), present a summary to the user.
Provide clear, actionable next steps as suggestions.
Example suggestions: "Address review comments first.", "Tackle the failing tests.", "Resolve merge conflicts."

tool.name: new_task (mode: translate)

best_practices.practice: Use when PR fixes involve changes to user-facing strings, i18n files, or UI components.
Provide specific details about what content needs translation in the message.
Include file paths and descriptions of the changes made.
List all affected languages that need updates.
Wait for translation completion before proceeding to validation phase.

when_to_use.trigger: Modifications to UI components with user-facing text
Updates to announcement files or documentation requiring localization
Addition of new error messages or user notifications

tool.example_usage:
<new_task> <mode>translate</mode> <message>Translation updates needed for PR #1234 fixes. Please translate the following changes:
Files modified: - webview-ui/src/i18n/locales/en/common.json: Added new error message "connection_failed" - webview-ui/src/components/settings/ApiSettings.tsx: Updated button text from "Save" to "Save Configuration"
Please ensure all supported languages (ca, de, es, fr, hi, id, it, ja, ko, nl, pl, pt-BR, ru, tr, vi, zh-CN, zh-TW) are updated with appropriate translations for these changes.</message> </new_task>
